byline.contributor: Rami Nazzal contributed reporting from Nabi Saleh, the West Bank, Sam Borden from Zurich, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Palestinians end effort to urge FIFA to suspend five Israeli soccer teams from settlements in West Bank from continuing to play in Israeli leagues; Palestinians agree to form FIFA committee to address their racism and discrimination complaints.
lead_paragraph: If approved, the move would have barred Israel from international competitions. A dispute over teams from settlements in the West Bank remained unresolved.

headline.main: Palestinian Soccer Association Drops Effort to Suspend Israel From FIFA
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Drop Effort to Block Israel From Soccer

snippet: If approved, the move would have barred Israel from international competitions. A dispute over teams from settlements in the West Bank remained unresolved.
